[[Verlyn Flieger]] | cinematography= | editing= | distributor= | released=1992, 1996 | runtime=110 minutes | country=England | language=English | budget= | website= }} '''''J.R.R.T.: A Portrait of J.R.R. Tolkien''''' is a [[1992]] documentary, narrated by [[wikipedia:Judi Dench|Judi Dench]], and produced Landseer Productions to celebrate the centenary of [[J.R.R. Tolkien]]'s birth. It features archive footage and audio recordings of J.R.R. Tolkien, and interviews with three of his children [[Priscilla Tolkien|Priscilla]], [[John Tolkien|John]], and [[Christopher Tolkien|Christopher]]. It also includes interviews with [[Baillie Tolkien]], [[Robert Murray]], [[Margrethe II of Denmark|Queen Margrethe II of Denmark]], [[Rayner Unwin]], [[Tom Shippey]], and [[Verlyn Flieger]]. == Release == The original [[1992]] release of the documentary had a runtime of around an hour. In [[1996]], a videocassete version of the documentary was released under the title ''"J.R.R.T.: A Film Portrait of J.R.R. Tolkien"'' and had a runtime of almost 110 minutes. [[Douglas A. Anderson]], ''Christopher Tolkien: A Bibliography'', in ''[[Tolkien's Legendarium| Tolkien's Legendarium: Essays on the History of Middle-earth]]'', pp. 251-252 == Credits == {| class="wikitable" |- |'''Narrator''' || Judi Dench |- |'''Production Assistant''' || Naseem Nathoo |- |'''Rostrum Camera''' || Ken Morse |- |'''Assistant Editor''' || Lucy Capewell |- |'''Sound''' || Roger di Vito |- | ||Nigel Davis |- |'''Dubbing Mixer''' || Colin Martin |- |'''Cameras''' || Nick Gifford |- | ||Barry Noakes |- |'''Editor''' || Francesca Ross |- |'''Director''' || Derek Bailey |- |'''Producer''' || Helen Dickinson |} ==External links== * [http://www.imdb.com/title/tt0297196/ IMDb profile] * [https://www.tolkienestate.com/audio-visual/visual/ Clips from the documentary on the Tolkien Estate website] {{references}} {{title|italics}} [[Category:Documentaries]]
